description.desc: The targeted disease agent must be COVID-19 of the value set list.
At most one r-event.
Date of first positive test must exist
The validation date must be after the date of first positive test plus 10 days
The validation date must be before the date of first positive test plus 365 days
At most one t-event.
For rapid or PCR test, the result must be negative ("not detected").
The test type must be one of the value set list (RAT OR NAA or serum antibody).
Date of sample collection must exist
The date of sample collection must be before the validation date
If the test type is "RAT" then the validation date must be before the date of sample collection plus 48 hours
If the test type is "PCR" then the validation date must be before the date of sample collection plus 72 hours
For serum antibody tests, the result must be positive.
If the test is a serum antibody test, then the validation date must be before the date of sample collection plus 90 days
At most one v-event.
Vaccination doses must be equal or greater than expected doses.
Only vaccines in the allowed valueset that have been approved by the EMA or are otherwise accepted in Switzerland are allowed.
Date of vaccination must exist
If the vaccine requires two doses, the vaccination date must be before today
If the vaccine requires one dose, and only one dose was administered, it becomes valid after 21 days
For 2/2 doses, the current date and time must be before the vaccination date plus 365 days for 2-dose vaccines
If the vaccine requires only one dose but more than one dose was administered, it is valid from today for 365 days
If the vaccine requires one dose, and only one dose was administered, it is valid until 365+21=386 days
